title: Great Taxi Transportation in Munich
text: I see many asking about Taxi and Uber in Munich. I highly recommend this Taxi service to anyone in need. The taxi ride from the airport to Munich is around 80 Euro. We just arrived from our hotel in Munich to the Airport to fly back home, as I stepped out of the Taxi, I realized I had left our passports and some personal items in the safe of our hotel. I got back in the taxi and asked our driver (Koulentianos Georgios), to take us back to the hotel and then bring us back.... He stopped us, called our hotel, spoke to the Concierge, who in turn brought hotel security and the front desk on the line - among themselves; they put all my possessions into an envelope. Georgios sent one of his taxis to pickup our belongings and bring it to us, saving us time and costs. He also provided us with the taxi's plate number, drivers name and phone number. Additionally, he waited at the airport for us, to ensure we were comfortable with the arrangement. On top of it all, he would not take anything extra for helping us, when we needed someone the most. His only request was that we tell friends and associates to contact him for any transportation requests in Munich. Please contact for your travels in Munich - Koulentianos Geordios Telephone: 017684316003 gkoulentiano@gmail.com ABIGTAXI.COM

title: For $250 per person, you can do much better.....
text: I have been to this restaurant in the past (in larger groups celebrating milestones), and have been generally satisfied. I have referred people to this restaurant as well. This last time I went, I did not feel right about some of the food that I had been served. I sent a message thru the restaurants website and after not hearing anything back, followed up by filling out a customer survey, requesting contact by someone. I have heard nothing back. I think at $250 per person, you should have complete satisfaction of your meal and if something is even remotely sub-standard, it should be addressed. It was NOT. There are more options....
place: Ruth's Chris Steak House Dixon Road

title: Amazing Lox and Bagels
text: The only place to have Lox and Bagels. Generous portions, fresh bagels and very good coffee. A must visit for all, to be followed by a visit to their factory to purchase additional bagels to take home

title: Great Steak!!
text: Great Steak! Side of lobster seemed to have little value. Steak was great as were the sides ordered with it. Shrimps and the cheese platter started the meal off extremely well, with a small but very good selections of wine

title: Disappointed with visit
text: I used to stay here, then I started staying at the Hotel Crystal. While it seems the hotel is implementing some great technology (text communication with concierge services), the execution of this technology is very disappointing. On this recent visit, one of my colleagues had trouble finding the hotel - the concierge and doorman would not help. I did enter this into a survey, and someone from their staff did send me an email that they will discuss this with the doorman... I did not feel it was a genuine email accepting their responsibility.

title: Every visit to Montreal should include this
text: For over 20 Years, every visit to Montreal has always atleast included one visit to Reuben's. The very best smoked meat, a must! As per always, the food and service was exempolary.

title: Great Schnitzel!
text: Best Schnitzel I had in Munich, covered the full plate and highly recommend it. Beer selection is adequate, but you are here for the schnitzel.

title: You can do better....
text: Hotel is well located right beside the English Garden. The daytime front desk staff was helpful. The evening and night time staff was extremely useless and rude. We got in late 10:00PM to the hotel, the gal at the front desk wouldn't even recommend where to find something to eat. We had to google ourselves to find a restaurant near by. We asked her to call us a cab, she insisted the cabs were all located beside the hotel. We walked in the rain around the hotel, because she did not tell us there was a closer door - to find no cabs.... She completely mis-informed us of the menu at the lounge. The service at the lounge was extremely poor, and while they had some premium drinks on their menu, there was not mixologist to prepare them properly. Its unfortunate that they charge the premium Hilton rates while providing poor service product. Breakfast was satisfactory.

title: Central Square
text: Nice central square providing nice buildings and lots to see. Good shopping for all types of goods and services

title: Nice Park to Visit
text: Very nice park to visit to walk through, several extremely nice restaurants and patios for lunch and dinner. If you have the time, very nice walk and dinner

title: Must Visit
text: First time at Oktoberfest, bucket list item. Good Bavarian food, Bavarian Beer and Bavarian times. Everyone should visit, everyone should visit while young, so you can enjoy it to the fullest and return the next year....

title: Great Food and Great Ambiance
text: Started with some delicious 12 oysters, which had to be repeated with another 12, after which came the Shrimp, followed by two great cuts of Steak. Highly recommend this steakhouse for their food and service

title: Must Visit!!!!
text: Great Food, Great Steaks and Great Service! Here is the reason you must visit, they way they serve, I have looked wherever I can, yet found nowhere. You order multiple cuts of meat (steak or other), order it cooked different in a variety of ways. The cuts are delivered on one chopping board, all organized for everyone to share these fantastic meats...

title: Great Fresh Seafood
text: Great Fresh Mackerel. Had the Lobster/Crab/Shrimp/Mackerel Platter. Amazing, it came with a side, don't eat it - focus on the seafood, extremely good. Easily enough for three

title: Great Fresh Fish
text: Fish is very fresh. You pick your fish. Do not have anything appetizers or anything additional to the fish, They will de-bone it for you at the table.Eat the fish, its delicious.

title: Its not just the place....
text: We arrived in Santorini with no expectations. My preference has always been hotels and not B&Bs. Our location, five minutes walk from Fira, our room three floors down a beautiful staircase, with a large room overlooking the Aegean Sea (with a small balcony thru the bathroom?). Our host Thomas upon our arrival directed us to immediately go to one of two restaurants to appreciate the sunset, but only with drinks, because dinner should be elsewhere later in the evening. We did just that. Each morning we were served a different gourmet breakfast (Thomas took tremendous pride in his skill as a chef), and told to relax. Thomas each morning would outline our day, by advising where, what, when, how and how much time. We followed his advise to the tee and had the best visit in Santorini that we can imagine. It is like he knew us, and knew exactly what we wanted to do and tailored it accordingly. We received a beautiful room over looking the Aegean, located in a beautiful building. Had personalized gourmet breakfasts each day, with a custom tailored guided tour, and all we had to do was book a room at Le Petit Greek

title: Great Dinning Experience
text: Had a late dinner at Niko's. Had their fish and a greek stew served in a foil bowl. Both dinners were delicious, the fish was better. The entire experience of the food, being there and the ambiance added to the experience of Mykonos nightlife

title: Must have Dinner - take a table in the laneway
text: We sat at a table in the laneway, by the open air oven. We watched them cook many dishes, and each looked more delicious than the next. We ordered numerous dishes, and each was better than the last. You cant go wrong with any of any of the fresh fish on the menu or the baked vegetables

title: Good Food... Convenient
text: Very convenient location, nice cuisine and comfortable. Nice view and good selection of seating. Menu is a bit limited

title: Great Quiet Beach
text: Beach was great, staff was friendly, available and did not bother. There were multiple water activities available if required

title: Great Stay on the Beach
text: This place is right on the beach. The staff was overwhelmingly accommodating (including Alex the masseuse who actually helped us with our luggage to the car, the day we checked out). The view from our room was breathtaking. This hotel is 25 Euro cab ride from Mykonos central We made a point of taking the complimentary 9:00PM shuttle (extremely prompt, show up at 9:01PM and the shuttle would be gone!) to town every night for a late dinner and gallivanting, before returning by cab in the wee hours of the morning. They included breakfast and Lunch or Dinner - I found this strange, but why complain - it was included. There were two menus, one that was included and one that was not - there was no upgrade from the included to the paid, it was either / or, this was a bit disappointing. However, we ate in Mykonos each evening, so this served well as a late lunch or an early pre-dinner snack. The restaurant was extremely punctual as well, if breakfast went till 10:00AM - the entire buffet was cleared by 10:02AM! Maria, helped us even when we had questions when we were in town. I am rating this property as Excellent even though I have outlined some weaknesses, these weaknesses only led us to other great things in Mykonos...

title: Must have Dinner.....
text: We had dinner at this restaurant at 9:00PM on a clear evening. We were provided a table right in front of the view of the Acropolis. The view was incredible, the food was fantastic. Surprisingly, the cost was quite reasonable based on the quality and value that was being delivered.

title: Must visit....
text: The Acropolis is a must visit. The site is full of history, and using the correct imagination, you can bring it alive. The staff at the Acropolis isn't very friendly, so be ready to figure things out using your own skills. I actually saw some staff screaming at some tourists who were a bit lost looking for certain structures.

title: Great view of Acropolis - Mediocre Hotel
text: I found the people in Athens, to be not the friendliest to tourists. Compared to the average hospitality experience in Athens, the staff at this hotel were perhaps the same or slightly better. The room was OK, nothing special. Initially, we had a small window that overlooked a dirty atrium, after asking to be moved, we had a decent view of the street - however the air conditioning had an issue.... Very interesting Jacuzzi and view - make sure you try it. Location of hotel great - right across the Acropolis, beside the museum and around the corner from Palak. The roof top Restaurant in the hotel - The Point - staff had an attitude, but the food, ambiance and the view of the Acropolis was fantastic.

title: Tour of China - odynovotours.com
text: We worked with Karen Yang at Odynovotours.com. She was extremely patient with our lack of familiarity with China. She planned a wonderful tour for us, on our schedule. Provided us with a wonderful guide in Beijing. Looked after us completely. We traveled to Beijing, Xi'an and Shanghai. Highly recommend this company and Karen if you are looking to visit China.

title: More Options Available
text:
Just checked in for two nights. Quite a disappointing start. First, they charged $20/night for parking and $10/night for "facility" fee. Fees that were not disclosed to us during the booking process. So add $30/night to your room rate. Second, we pay the facility fee, but the TV in our room does not work - there is an issue with the antennae. The luggage carts require air in the wheels, so bringing in luggage to room is very difficult, of course no one is available to help. And to add to the above
deficiencies, the air conditioning in the room does not work. Hoping this is the last of the issues.

I am a frequent visitor to Niagara Falls, there are too many better options, rather than settling for this hotel.
place: Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Niagara Falls

title: Great Place for a Getaway
text: We stayed at this hotel for a short getaway to catch a concert at the Bell Center. Friendly Staff, perfect suite, great location and special efforts by the concierge helped us celebrate my wife's birthday. Comfortable bed, clean and a nice ambiance. Disappointed the restaurant hasn't opened back up yet, still great gastronomy is steps away in each direction.

title: Awesome Food
text: The food is good, prices are right and service is fast. Highly recommend if you are looking for a nice Pizza or Italian Sandwiches. Recommend the Rice Ball as well

title: Better Options Available
text:
The Food is good, but the service is extremely disappointing. It is not inexpensive. There are several equivalent options (food quality, taste and prices) within a two minute walk - Khazana and Khana Sutra. Much Better Options, would recommend them over this restaurant. The Service in this restaurant is very poor, including a dishonest staff.

Elsewhere is better

title: Menu looks good, service needs much improvement.
text: On a holiday, looking for a place to make things and keep things easy. Nice location, but ... Have some issues getting a table, then once we have it - we are given a late night menu, we ask - why? We are told the late night menu starts at 10:00PM (it's 9:45), or whenever the manager deems it time! We decide to leave, that's two strikes, I don't see any point in having a bad avoidable experience. As we walk out we see tables seated after us and being seated with full menus. The night before a waitress tells us that this place cross contaminates with seafood and nuts all over, manager confirms it. So if you have family with allergies .... Someone needs to tell these owners about tourism!! Want a great burger and the trimmings - try Repeal on 22nd and Atlantic - they know how to do it right.

title: Best Burger in Virginia Beach!!
text: Great Burgers, Great Selection of Whiskies and whisky based cocktails. Their cocktail suggestions and burgers are very creative and tasty. Ensure you have their tempura mushrooms, blue cheese burger and their truffle Mac and cheese. Drinks like Rob Roy and Waldorf mixed to perfection. Service is provided by all staff for a great dining experience.

title: Good Place to Visit
text: We stayed close by, we went to ynot daily for dinner or desert. The bruschetta is not that great, but their cappuccino is better than Starbucks! Americanized Italian food. There is something for everyone. New York Style Pizza as it is supposed to be. Prices are very reasonable for the food and drinks. Desserts are very good.

title: 18 Year Old Lived it!
text: My 18 Year old want d to try surfing. They taught her well, one session and she was almost standing up. She felt confident enough to do some on her own and intends to continue. Good company to deal with.

title: Excellent Choice
text: Terrific Property, Terrific Amenities, Terrific Location, and best of all the Cost was very affordable. 20 Minutes by Metro to the Capital. Great People, Great Staff - always available to help. On-Site restaurant was excellent, but the service in the restaurant was very very poor. If you can live with poor service in the restaurant, but everything else excellent - I would recommend nothing other than this hotel.

title: Great Description - but short on delivery
text: Hotel is very dated. Furniture and appliances are very old. Housekeeping is not even an option as a paid service. Rooms are small. Internet is incredibly poor, they may as well not even offer Internet at what they offer. Location is 18 Blocks from the main area. Before renting here, consider other possibilities. I tethered my computer off my phone to get any type of speed to access the internet.

title: Dinner with Family
text: Good Food, Good Drinks, Good Service, Fair Price. Group of Six - 20% Gratuity automatic - Agest 12 - 52. Waiter went out of his way to ensure all were looked after.

title: Great Visit
text: But ensure to visit the SNAS in Chantilly Virginia when visiting - Discovery Shuttle, Enola Gay and Concorde on display.

title: A Must See
text: Great Place to visit, connected to the US Capitol Building. Great Architecture, history and displays

title: Good Food, Good Prices, Good Service and Good Fun
text: As the title said all was good, highly recommend it. Portions are large and the staff is friendly. Food tastes great and the prices are fair.

title: Not worth the money!!
text: Went for lunch - party of 8. Should have been an hour and a half lunch, turned into 3.5 hours. Staff very scarce to find. Took over 45 minutes to get drinks, further 45 minutes to order and a further 45 minutes to get food. Food wasn't as good as they think it is. They gave us a discount on food, but due to their service or lack of we had to pay for parking.
